intro: Scorzonera bicolor, commonly known as the purple scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to purple. Scorzonera bicolor is known for its attractive appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
